Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a ribbed brown pottery vessel, fabric red/brown/black in section, with remains of at least five lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, now very worn and faded, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.217)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87687) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87687)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 376 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
